result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Henry Schott

defendant.name: Schott, Daniel Henry
defendant.address: 339 S Main St, West Bend, WI 53095

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel Henry Schott in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 15CT94, Court grants the State's motion. Conditions of bail remitted.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel

Defendant Daniel Henry Schott in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant can petition the court or seek counsel. Court will give another date in approximately 2 weeks. Defendant given the petition for appointment of counsel to fill out. Defendant may seek private counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Henry Schott not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant called and stated he had a work emergency and requested another date. Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Daniel Henry Schott in court, in custody.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not have counsel. Court addresses defendant's absence. Criminal Complaint given to defendant.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED by the Court. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation or Defendant to seek counsel. Court sets bail at $100.00 cash with the same conditions on 15CT94.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
